techmeme.title: Researchers detail the Blast-RADIUS MD5-based vulnerability affecting RADIUS, a widely-used network access authentication protocol first developed in 1991 (Dan Goodin/Ars Technica)
A profile of Lee Saedol, an 18-time Go world champion who was beaten by Google DeepMind's AlphaGo in 2016 and now gives lectures about AI after retiring in 2019 (New York Times)
A look at the rise of algorithmic trading in currency markets: ~50% of hedge funds are using the tech for FX trading in 2024, up from 22% before the pandemic (Bloomberg)
Q&A with Meta CTO Andrew Bosworth on the company's metaverse strategy, barriers to MR/VR growth, Reality Labs spending, AR glasses, AI, and more (Matthew Ball/MatthewBall.co)
An investigation finds Airbnb fails to protect its guests from hidden cameras and moves swiftly to contain user complaints and resolve them out of court (CNN)
